required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Adjunctive Troriluzole in Obsessive Compulsive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial of Adjunctive Troriluzole in Obsessive Compulsive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The study's purpose is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of troriluzole as adjunctive therapy compared to placebo in subjects with Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The total score on the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale (YBOCS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in total score from baseline, assessed at screening, baseline, week 4, 8 &10
primary_outcome.description: Improvement is measured by a lower total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of SAEs and AEs leading to discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Screening through study completion, up to 10 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percent difference between troriluzole vs placebo treatment emergent adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in functional disability as assessed by the change in Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline through study completion (up to 10 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change is measured as "mild" or "moderate" on the SDS

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in global functioning responses assessed on the CGI-I scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline through study completion (up to 10 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change is measured as "much improved" or "very much improved" on the CGII scale

arm_group.description: Troriluzole - 2 100mg capsules once daily for the first two weeks. Troriluzole - 2 140mg capsules once daily from week two through week ten.
Placebo - 2 100mg capsules once daily for the first two weeks. Placebo - 2 140mg capsules once daily from week two through week ten.

intervention.description: Troriluzole - 2 100mg capsules QD for the first two weeks.
Matching placebo - 2 140mg capsules QD from week two through week ten.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Primary diagnosis of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) as per Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition as confirmed by the MINI at Screening; The duration of the subject's illness must be â‰¥ 1 year
2. An inadequate response to current Standard of Care medication defined as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (excluding fluvoxamine) or clomipramine treatment at an adequate and stable dose for at least 8 weeks prior to screening and at least 12 weeks at baseline (adequate dose defined by USPI labeling); an inadequate response as defined per the MGH-TRQ-OCD, there has been minimal or no meaningful clinical benefit as perceived by the subject
3. Determined by the investigator to be medically stable at baseline/randomization as assessed by medical history, physical examination, laboratory test results, and electrocardiogram testing. Subjects must be physically able and expected to complete the trial as designed
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects with a history of more than two (2) previous failed or inadequate treatment classes given for an adequate duration at an adequate dose as defined by the MGH-TRQ-OCD.
2. Current or prior history of: bipolar I or II disorder, schizophrenia or other psychotic disorders, schizoaffective disorder, autism or autistic spectrum disorders, borderline personality disorder, antisocial personality disorder, Tourette's disorder, body dysmorphic disorder, hoarding disorder; or psychosurgery, Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) or Electroconvulsive Therapy (ECT); or general medical condition that may confound safety and/or efficacy results
3. Previous treatment in a study with troriluzole

facility.name: Yale University / Connecticut Mental Health Center
South Florida Research Phase I-IV , Inc.
Medical Research Group of Central Florida
Texas Center for Drug Development, Inc.
